title: Relates to reimbursement of certain transportation costs provided by parents of students
summary: Provides that the New York city school district shall reimburse parents for the cost of certain transportation which is provided by parents where children remain in school until 5:00 pm or later for regularly scheduled academic classes.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2731

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the education law, in relation to reimbursement of certain
transportation costs provided by parents of students

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
This bill will require New York City schools to reimburse parents who
transport their children from school, if the student stays past five
o'clock for academic reasons.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Adds a new subdivision 8 to section 3635 of the Education Law to
require the New York City school district to reimburse parents as
much as it would otherwise have paid for transportation of the child,
The transportation is made State aidable. The following requirements
must be met:

* Parents must apply in the same way as application for school
transportation.

* The child must attend school for academic reasons past five o'clock
or weekdays.

* The child must reside at least one-half mile from school for K-2,
and one mile for grades 3-6.

* If the district chooses to offer transportation for a lesser
distance, it must offer it to all children in like circumstance.

JUSTIFICATION:
This legislation addresses specific provisions of transportation in
New York city, where parents are concerned that extended day
education may result in potential danger to their children.

PRIOR LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2007-2008: S.4498 - Referred to Education
2009-2010: S.2126 - Referred to Education

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
There is no fiscal impact, since City and State costs are the same
whether transportation is provided by the city or by the parent.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first of July next succeeding the
date on which it shall have become a law.
